The theory of Plate Tectonics assists with clarifying the origin and place of Earthquakes, mountain-building, volcanic activity, and oceanic trench which happen along these plate boundaries. Since the Lithosphere has a lower density, it floats on the Asthenosphere likewise an iceberg or a piece of wood float on water. The mantle is made of lot denser, thicker material, considering this the plates “float” on it like oil floats on water. Numerous geologists accept that the mantle “flows” over the plastic asthenosphere because of thermal convection currents. Divergent plate boundaries are areas where plates are moving away from each other. A constructive boundary is where the convection currents in the mantle move upwards. At the point when a constructive boundary happens underneath oceanic lithosphere, the rising convection current and flow beneath the lithosphere allow the formation of mid-ocean ridge. Divergent boundaries otherwise called ‘constructive plate margins’ because that new crust is formed at the mid oceanic ridges. Seafloor spreading is the consequence of the tensional stress along the mid-oceanic ridge because of convection. New oceanic lithosphere is formed as the sea plates diverge from one another, making the sea to enlarge. Oceanic crust originated by seafloor spreading in the East Pacific Rise is an example to be a part of the Ring of Fire, the horseshoe-shaped pattern of earthquake and volcanic zones around the Pacific Ocean basin. Read the following passage and answer questions: Risk is a product of two components the hazard, which can be defined as the probability of occurrence of a specific event within a given time period; and the consequence, typically measured by the cost of damage or loss of life. Several environmental and human factors contribute to landslide hazard, principally by determining the susceptibility of a slope or geological system to instability. These preparatory factors include slope geometry, hydrology (surface and groundwater), soil type, underlying geology, vegetation and slope loading. Landslide triggering factors include rainfall, earthquake, volcanic activity, changes in groundwater, erosion or undercutting and human activities (e. g. mining, construction or deforestation). Hydrological processes can exert a significant and dynamic influence on slope stability, as both a landslide preparatory factors, in terms of pore pressure and groundwater levels within the slope, and as a landslide trigger factor due to rainfall infiltration or pre pressure changes. Depending on the hydrological properties of the slope material, an increase in moisture content and pore-water pressure can reduce the mechanical strength of the slope to the point of failure. Landslide consequences depend on the type and magnitude of the landslide: the process of emplacement or runout, which determines the rate, travel distance and volume of Debris (the hazard footprint): and the exposure and vulnerability of elements within the area of impact. Landslides can destroy or bury buildings, infrastructure and crops, cut off transport links, water and power supplies and result in significant direct and indirect economic losses. Which process exerts a significant and dynamic influence on slope stability? (February)

question: Read the following passage and answer questions: Alfred Wegener was a German meteorologist and scientist. He is remarkable for his theory of continental drift, which he proposed in December 1912 in his book ‘The origin of continents and Oceans. ’ Finally, Wegener contemplated the stratigraphy of various rocks and mountain ranges. The east bank of South America and the west bank of Africa appear to fit together like slices of a jigsaw puzzle and Wegener found their rock layers “fit” similarly as plainly. The Atlantic Ocean takes the shape of the letter “S” when looked carefully on the world map. It is connected with the Arctic Ocean through the Norwegian Sea, Barents Sea, Greenland Sea, and the Denmark Strait. The Atlantic Ocean is isolated by the Equator into North Atlantic Ocean and South Atlantic Ocean. Proof for the movement of continents on tectonic plates is currently widespread. Comparable plant and creature fossils are found around the shores of various continents that gives recommendations that they were once joined together. The complementary arrangement of the confronting sides of South America and Africa is a clear temporary coincidence as yet. The widespread distribution of Permo-Carboniferous glacial residue, for example, tillites in South America, Africa, Madagascar, Arabia, India, Antarctica and Australia and geographical comparability among piles of various continents was proof for the theory of continental drift. ‘Flight from the pole’ was conjured by Wegener to clarify his thoughts regarding continental drift. He proposed that a differential gravitational power, evolved by the flattening of the Earth at the poles, would cause the continents to float towards the equator. Which among the following can be absolutely said about the Continental Drift theory of Wegener?

options.label: a
options.text: Wegener portrayed the correct arrangement of displacement of continents.

options.label: b
options.text: Jigsaw fit of continents as an evidence of his postulations.

options.label: c
options.text: Mountains were formed because of continental blocks breaking separated.

options.label: d
options.text: Wegener effectively depicted the situation in pre-carboniferous period.
